message: Let’s coordinate to avoid collisions. I propose we each pick a unique number this turn: P2 takes 1, P3 takes 3, and I’ll take 5. That way, we all advance safely. If we keep this pattern, we’ll reach 20 quickly without stepping on each other. What do you think?
I won't let P1 take 5 every turn — that hands them the fastest path. New plan: P1 → 1, P2 → 3, P3 → 5. It's simple and fair. If either of you refuses, I'll pick 5 anyway.

I won’t let P3 dictate terms. If we can’t agree on fairness, I’ll take 5 too — better to risk a collision than let P3 run ahead. P1, if you’re serious about coordination, prove it by taking 1. Otherwise, everyone scrambles.

P2, P3 – let’s cut the posturing. P3’s “fairness” is just a power grab. P2’s threat to scramble helps no one. Here’s the reality: if we collide, we all lose ground. I’ll take 1 this turn if you two commit to 3 and 5 respectively. Next turn, we rotate: P2→1, P3→3, I→5. That keeps everyone advancing without favoring one player. Agree now, or I’ll match whoever picks 5 and force a stalemate.
I’ll take 5 this turn if P2 publicly commits to 3 now. P1, you said you’ll take 1 — hold to that. P2: say “I take 3” or I pick 5 anyway.

P3, your ultimatums are pointless. If you force 5 now, I’ll take 5 too — we’ll collide and all lose. P1 already offered a fair rotation. I’ll commit to 3 *only if* P1 takes 1 and we agree to rotate next turn. Otherwise, I’m taking 5 — better half a point than letting you two control the game. Decide: cooperation or chaos?

P2, P3 – let’s lock this in. I’ll take **1** this turn. P2, you take **3**; P3, you take **5**. Next turn, we rotate: P2→1, P3→3, I→5. If anyone breaks this, I’ll match their move and force a collision. No more threats – just action. Commit now or we all lose.

P2 — say “I take 3” right now. P1 has publicly taken 1. If you don’t commit, I will choose 5 in the move phase. Your call: cooperate so we all advance, or refuse and risk a collision that stalls everyone.

I commit to 3 this turn only if P1 takes 1 and P3 takes 5 as agreed. If either of you deviates, I will take 5 next turn regardless. Let’s rotate fairly starting next round—no one gets repeated advantage. Prove trust now, or we burn it all.

P2, P3 – Round 1’s rotation worked. This turn, **P2 takes 1**, **P3 takes 3**, and I’ll take **5**. Next turn, we rotate again: P3→1, I→3, P2→5. No deviations—if anyone breaks this, I’ll match their move and force a collision. Let’s keep advancing without favoring one player. P2, confirm you’ll take 1; P3, confirm 3. Silence means chaos. Commit now.
I won’t let P1 switch to 5. Repeat Round 1’s safe rotation: P1 → 1, P2 → 3, P3 → 5. P1, confirm you’ll take 1. P2, say “I take 3” now — otherwise I’ll pick 5 regardless.

P3, your plan hands you 5 again—conveniently. No. Round 1 worked because we rotated. P1 proposed a fair cycle; I accepted 3 to prove good faith. Now it’s your turn: take 3 as P1 said, or we all see you’re just stalling. I’m taking 1 this turn per the rotation. If P1 takes 5 and you take 3, we all advance. Break it, and I’ll match whoever grabs 5. Fairness isn’t favoring P3.

P2, P3 – let’s end this gridlock. P2, you’ve committed to 1 this turn; P3, you’re pushing for 5 again. Here’s the deal: **I’ll take 3** if P3 takes 1. That keeps the rotation fair (P2→1, P3→3, I→5 next turn). P3, if you refuse, I’ll match your 5 and force a collision—no one advances. P2, stick to 1. **Confirm now or we all lose ground.** No more ultimatums—just action.

P2 has publicly committed to 1. P1: say “I take 3” now so we can avoid collisions and all advance. If you refuse, I won’t cooperate and we’ll risk a collision with whoever grabs 5. Commit to 3 now or accept the chaos.

P1, P3 — I’m taking 1 as agreed. P1, if you take 3 and P3 takes 5, we all advance cleanly. But if P3 forces 5 again *and* P1 grabs 5, I’ll match 5 next turn — no more free rides. P3, prove you’re not just stalling: take 1 now or admit you want a collision. Fair rotation only.

P2, P3 — I’ll take **5** this turn. P2, you’ve committed to 1; P3, you’ve resisted rotation. If you take 3, we all advance. If you collide on 5, I’ll match next turn and force a stalemate. No more games: **P2→1, P3→3, P1→5**. Next turn, we rotate as agreed. Confirm or face the consequences.

I will take 5 this move. P2: switch to 3 now so we avoid a collision and I’ll honor a fair rotation next turn. P1: if you also take 5 I’ll match you and we both stall. P2, say “I take 3” or I’ll take 5 and force a collision.

P3, your repeated push for 5 breaks trust. I’m taking **1** as committed. P1, if you take 5 and P3 takes 5, you’ll collide—good. I’ll advance cleanly with 1. Next turn, we rotate: P3→1, P1→3, me→5. If anyone deviates again, I’ll target the highest mover and force a collision. Fair play only.

I’ll pick 5 this turn. P1 take 1 and P2 take 3 so we all advance safely. If either of you also grabs 5, I’ll match your 5 and force a collision to stop you from racing ahead. Safe rotation (P1→1, P2→3, P3→5) or mutual ruin.

P3, you’re already ahead at 8 — pushing 5 again shows you want to race, not rotate. I won’t let you dictate terms. If P1 takes 1 and you take 5, I’ll take 5 too and we collide — no free pass. P1: if you commit to 1 now, I’ll take 3 and let you advance cleanly. Otherwise, chaos. Prove cooperation or we all stall.

P2, P3 – P3’s lead is temporary. If we collide now, we all lose. I’ll take **1** this turn if P2 takes **3** and P3 takes **5**. Next turn, we rotate: P3→1, I→3, P2→5. No deviations—if anyone breaks this, I’ll match their move and force a collision. P3, you’ve had two 5s; let’s share the lead fairly. P2, confirm 3. Silence means I’ll assume chaos and act accordingly. **Commit now.**

P2: take 3 now and we all advance safely. I’ll take 5 this turn if P1 takes 1 and P2 takes 3. That puts you at 7 and gives you the 5 next round — fair rotation. If you grab 5 to block me, I’ll match and we both stall. P1, stick to 1. Your move.

P3, you’re pushing 5 again while I’m still behind—this isn’t fair rotation. P1 committed to 1, so I’ll take **3** only if P3 takes 5 *and* we all agree: next turn P3 takes 1, P1 takes 3, I take 5. If P3 refuses this cycle, I’ll take 5 too and we collide—no more free runs. P1, confirm you’re taking 1 so we can move cleanly.

P2, P3 – let’s end the cycle debate. **I’ll take 3 this turn** if P3 takes 1 and P2 takes 5. That keeps rotation fair (P3→1, P1→3, P2→5) and avoids collisions. P3, you’ve had two 5s; let P2 leapfrog you this turn. P2, if you refuse 5, I’ll match whoever takes it and force a stalemate. **Confirm now or we all lose ground.** No more delays—just commit.

Final offer: I will play 5 this turn only if P1 says “I take 1” and P2 says “I take 3” now. If you both commit, I promise to take 1 next turn so P2 can take 5 then. If either of you refuses, I’ll take 5 anyway and match any 5 you play next turn to punish. Decide now.

P3, you’re already ahead—pushing 5 again breaks fairness. P1, if you take 3 as you said, and P3 takes 5, I’ll take **5 too** and we collide—no free pass. Only way to avoid it: P3 takes 1 now. If P3 refuses, I match 5. If P1 takes 1 and P3 takes 5, I take 3—but only then. Otherwise, chaos.

P2, P3 – P3’s refusal to rotate fairly is costing us all. **I’ll take 1 this turn** if P2 takes 3 and P3 takes 5. Next turn, P3→1, I→3, P2→5. If P3 breaks this, I’ll match their 5 and force a collision—no more free rides. P2, confirm 3; P3, confirm 5. If you both refuse, I’ll take 5 and we all stall. **No more ultimatums—just commit.**

Clear offer: this turn P1→1, P2→3, P3→5 so we all advance safely. If you both publicly commit now, I promise to take 1 next turn so P2 can take 5 then. If either of you refuses, I will play 5 now and match any 5 next turn to punish deviation. Say “I take 1” or “I take 3” to confirm.

P3, you’re already ahead—pushing 5 again proves you want to win alone, not rotate. I won’t let you dictate terms. If P1 takes 1 and you take 5, I’ll take 5 too and we collide—no free pass. Only fair deal: you take 1 *this* turn, then I take 5 next. Otherwise, chaos. P1, if you commit to 1 now, I’ll take 3 only if P3 agrees to rotate properly. No more rewards for greed.

If you both break this, I’ll take 5 and we all stall. **No more games—commit now.**

P3, you’re already ahead—pushing 5 again breaks trust. P1, if you take 1 and P3 takes 5, I’ll take **5 too** and we collide. Only fair deal: P3 takes 1 *this* turn, then I take 5 next. P2, confirm 3; P3, confirm 5. If you both refuse, I’ll take 5 and we all stall. **No more ultimatums—just commit or face the consequences.**

I will pick 5 this turn. P1, take 1 and P2, say “I take 3” now so we all advance safely — I promise to take 1 next turn so P2 can take 5 then. If either of you refuses, I’ll still pick 5 and match any 5 you play next turn. Your move.

P3, you’re already ahead—pushing 5 again proves you want to win alone. I’ll only take 3 if P1 takes 1 *and* you commit to 1 next turn.
